meanings.definition: Pieces of material that are left over after something has been cut.
meanings.sent1: I collected the offcuts of fabric to use for my craft project.
meanings.sent2: The tailor saved the offcuts to use for patching up other clothes.
meanings.sent3: The offcuts of paper danced in the wind like tiny butterflies.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of offcuts of memories, waiting to be pieced together.
meanings.sent5: The offcuts of wood were scattered across the workshop floor, waiting to be swept up.

meanings.definition: A small piece of material that has been cut off from a larger piece.
meanings.sent1: She found an offcut of ribbon under the table.
meanings.sent2: The offcut of leather was too small to be used for the project.
meanings.sent3: The offcut of cake was so tiny, it was gone in one bite.
meanings.sent4: His words felt like an offcut of truth in a sea of lies.
meanings.sent5: The offcut of fabric was just enough to patch the hole in his jeans.
